questions.text: A 63-year-old man with a history of hyperlipidaemia presents to the dermatology clinic with a 6-month history of progressively worsening dry skin and scaling. He denies any history of similar skin conditions in himself or his family. Physical examination reveals diffuse, fine, white scaling on the lower extremities without erythema.
